content.title: Incentive To Saharia Students For B.Ed
content.details: The basic objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance to the students of the Saharia region for B.Ed training so that the tribal students of the Saharia region can keep their participation in the government service. In this scheme, hostel fees, scholarships (stipends), tuition fees, and stationery are given to these students. Provision has been made to give financial assistance in the form of The benefit of the scheme will be payable only for 10 months.
benefits: Rs.30,000 in the first year and Rs.30,000 in the second year for Saharia tribe students taking regular B.Ed training.
Rs. 26,000/- for college fees and purchase of books.
Rs. 32,000/- for house rent and food.
eligibility: The student should be a native of Rajasthan.
The student should belong to Saharia class, a tribe of the Baran district of Rajasthan.
The student should be a regular trainee in the government / non-government BEd training institute.
The student's mother/father/guardian should not be a taxpayer.
Students living in government-run hostels are not entitled to benefits under the scheme.
Students should have a Vaidya Bhamashah card and Aadhaar.
content.application_process: Applicant students have to visit the official website. Now Select the Login option or Register Option. Applicants will be redirected to the Rajasthan SSO portal. Now students can log in with their Jan-Aadhaar ID. Fill out the application form. Attach the required documents. Submit.

faqs.question: In Rajasthan, who runs the 'Incentive To Saharia Students For B.Ed' scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is run by the 'Tribal Area Development Department' from 2004-05.

faqs.question: What Are The Benefits Under The Scheme?
faqs.answer: Saharia tribe students who are taking regular B.Ed training are given Rs.30,000 in the first year and Rs.30,000 in the second year.

faqs.question: Who Can Get The Benefits Of The Scheme?
faqs.answer: All Saharia class students who are native of Rajasthan and fulfilling the eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: What is the educational eligibility criteria?
faqs.answer: The student should be a regular trainee in the government / non-government BEd training institute.

faqs.question: What Is The Financial Eligibility Criteria?
faqs.answer: The student's mother/father/guardian should not be a taxpayer.

faqs.question: May other state persons apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the student should be a native of Rajasthan.

faqs.question: How To Apply For The Scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicant students have to visit the official website, select the Login or Register option, log in with their Jan-Aadhaar ID, fill out the application form, attach the required documents, and submit.

faqs.question: What Documents Are Needed?
faqs.answer: Caste Certificate Copy, Aadhar Card Copy, Education Qualification Marksheet / Certificate Copy, Income Certificate Copy, Jan Aadhar/Bhamashah Card Copy.
